pr_title: [BEAM-8889] Cleanup Beam to GCS connector interfacing code so it uses higher level objects such as GoogleCloudStorage.

timeline.bodyText: I'm a bit hesitant to have this but i'm okay if we have to. @chamikaramj Do you think this is still necessary? If this is required, we might consider to have new API in getCloudStorage().create to accept uploadBufferSizeBytes to avoid code for each type of channels.
timeline.author: veblush

replies.bodyText: This seems to be replaced with using AsyncWriteChannelOptions.setUploadChunkSize in GoogleCloudStorageOptions.WriteChannelOptions.
replies.author: veblush

timeline.bodyText: Can we combine this with code below? Does it need to call setGrpcEnabled, too?
timeline.author: veblush

replies.bodyText:
fixed.
I had to rework the code a bit to assume that gcsio doesn't yet have grpc support - but make this code almost ready to use it when it is available in gcsio
replies.author: vnorigoog

timeline.message:
This now includes changes to make Beam GCS connector code ready to use
gRPC when gcsio is released with gRPC support.
Merge branch 'grpc-changes' of https://github.com/vnorigoog/beam into grpc-changes
This now includes changes to make Beam GCS connector code ready to use gRPC when gcsio is released with gRPC support.
Merge branch 'grpc-changes' of https://github.com/vnorigoog/beam into grpc-changes

timeline.bodyText: Seems like this changes contentType from whatever provided above to always null. We should check the code base to see if this may introduce any behavioral changes.
timeline.author: chamikaramj

replies.bodyText:
Was this addressed ? I see this being used in a number of places and probably users can set mime type themselves since this is a pipeline option. Can this be a breaking change for some users (or some applications of Beam) ?
For example,

  
    
      beam/sdks/java/io/google-cloud-platform/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/gcp/bigquery/BigQueryRowWriter.java
    
    
         Line 58
      in
      35da90a
    
    
    
    

        
          
           channel = FileSystems.create(resourceId, mimeType);
replies.author: chamikaramj

replies.bodyText: I think this can be address by passing CreateObjectOptions to googleCloudStorage.create. CreateObjectOptions has a way to configure ContentType.
replies.author: veblush

timeline.message: Merge branch 'grpc-changes' of https://github.com/vnorigoog/beam into grpc-changes
Merge branch 'grpc-changes' of https://github.com/vnorigoog/beam into grpc-changes
Merge branch 'grpc-changes' of https://github.com/vnorigoog/beam into grpc-changes
